always_online.title: Always Onlineu2122
always_online.description: If your server goes down, Cloudflare will serve your website's static pages from our cache.
always_online.help:
#### What does Always Online mean?
If your server goes down, Cloudflare will serve your website's most popular pages from our cache. For more information see [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/always-online/).

Visitors viewing a cached page will receive a message informing them that they are in an offline browsing mode. As soon as your server comes back online, Cloudflare will move users back to regular browsing.

**Note:** If Cloudflare does not have the requested page in its cache, visitors will receive an error page letting them know the requested page is offline.

Refer to our support guide to [understand the limitations of Always Online](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/always-online/).
always_online.v2.description: Keep your website online for visitors when your origin server is unavailable. Cloudflare serves limited copies of web pages available from the [Internet Archiveu2019s Wayback Machine](https://archive.org/web/).
always_online.v2.terms: Enabling this Service will share some of your websiteu2019s information with the Internet Archive in order to make this feature functional. By enabling this Service, you agree to the [Supplemental Terms](https://www.cloudflare.com/supplemental-terms/#AOBeta) for Always Online.
ampersand.description:
Enabling this feature will serve your existing AMP pages from your own domain.

**Note:** This feature does not convert your regular pages to AMP
ampersand.modal.content:
Type in the pattern that Ampersand will use to accelerate certain pages on your website. Be as specific as possible.

For example:

* if you want **http://example.com/amp/article-1** to be accelerated by Ampersand, type in **.*example.com\/amp\.\/***
* if you want **https://amp.example.com/article-1** to be accelerated by Ampersand, type in **.*amp.example.com\/.***
* if you want **https://example.com/article-1?amp** to be accelerated by Ampersand, type in **.*(\?amp|&amp).***
ampersand.modal.rewrite_resources_subtex: Enabling this option will make your AMP pages much faster by changing assets to first-party.
ampersand.modal.title: Ampersand: AMP Cache for Publishers
ampersand.title: Ampersand
browser_cache_ttl.description: Determine the length of time Cloudflare instructs a visitor's browser to cache files. During this period, the browser loads the files from its local cache, speeding up page loads.
browser_cache_ttl.help:
#### What does the Browser Cache TTL do?
The Browser Cache TTL specifies how long cached files will remain in your visitor's browser cache. This expiration time is what Cloudflare will set unless longer time periods are specified at your web server.

A longer expiration time ensures faster load times for repeat visitors. However, a longer expiration time also means slower update times if those files are modified.

[Learn more about Browser Cache TTL](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/edge-browser-cache-ttl/#browser-cache-ttl).

**Note:** You can also increase the cache expiration by specifying a longer cache time on the origin server, or you can set a different Cache Expiration for a specific path or resource using Cache Rules. Cloudflare will use whichever value is longer between your origin server cache headers and your Cloudflare setting
browser_cache_ttl.title: Browser Cache TTL

caching.analytics.promo.benefit1: Go beyond "cached" and "uncached" stats: see if resources are missing cache, expired, or are never eligible for cache in the first place.
caching.analytics.promo.benefit2: Slice and dice your data as you see fit: filter by hostnames, or see a list of top URLs that miss cache.
caching.analytics.promo.benefit3: Query up to three days of data blazing fast (and even longer queries coming soon).
caching.analytics.promo.card.description: With Cache Analytics, get deeper insights into the usage of your cache. Filter by hostnames, see a list of resources that are cached and uncached, and optimize your cache settings to make your website faster.

Served from origin. Expired in cache.
Cache bypassed due to Cache-Control response from origin.
Served from origin. Caching not configured.

Served from cache while resource is still loading.

caching.headline: Caching
caching.subheadline: Manage caching settings for your website
caching.tab.overview.description: Review your website or application cache performance. Only includes data on end-user traffic to your <0>Cloudflare-proxied hostnames</0>. Subrequests from Cloudflare Workers are not included.
caching.tab.tiered_cache.description: Reduce requests to customer origins by dramatically increasing cache hit ratios using Cloudflare's global network.
caching.tab.cache_reserve.description: Use Cloudflare's persistent storage to increase cache times.
caching.tab.cache_rules.description: Specify which resources should be cached and for how long.
caching.tiered_cache.argo_upsell.title: Enabling Tiered Caching
caching.tiered_cache.argo_upsell.descrip: Tiered Caching is available to enable in the<0> Traffic Tab</0> under the Argo section.
Tiered Caching is a product that uses optimized routes across Cloudflare 200+ data centers to <0>deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely.</0>
Enabling Argo activates Tiered Caching and Smart Routing, reducing Internet latency on average by more than 30% and connection errors by 27%.
caching.tiered_cache.control_cache_topol: Control cache topology under the<0> Argo</0> section on the<1> Traffic tab.</1>
caching.tiered_cache.tc_toggle_card.help:
**Tiered Caching**

Tiered caching's technology uses regional tier 1 Cloudflare data centers to propagate content to Cloudflareu2019s global network, minimizing static content requests to your server, while reducing bandwidth and total costs.
caching.tiered_cache.tc_toggle_card.desc:
Tiered Caching is a service that uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network to **deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely.**

Tiered caching is a practice where Cloudflare's network of global data centers are divided into a hierarchy of upper-tiers and lower-tiers. In order to control bandwidth and number of connections between an origin and Cloudflare, only upper-tiers are permitted to request content from an origin and are responsible for distributing information to the lower-tiers.

By enabling Tiered Cache, Cloudflare will dynamically find the single best upper tier for an origin using Argo performance and routing data.

This practice improves bandwidth efficiency by limiting the number of data centers that can ask the origin for content, reduces origin load, and makes websites more cost-effective to operate.
caching_level.description: Determine how much of your website's static content you want Cloudflare to cache. Increased caching can speed up page load time.
caching_level.help:
#### What are Cloudflare's [Caching Levels](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/set-caching-levels)?
You can set Cloudflare's CDN to cache [static content](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/concepts/default-cache-behavior/) according to these levels:

- **No Query String:** Only delivers files from cache when there is no query string.
- **Ignore Query String:** Delivers the same resource to everyone independent of the query string.
- **Standard:** Delivers a different resource each time the query string changes.

We recommend using the Standard level. [Learn more about caching levels](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/set-caching-levels).

**Note:** By default, Cloudflare does not cache HTML content. You can create a Cache Rule to [cache static HTML content](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/concepts/customize-cache/).
caching_level.title: Caching Level
development_mode.description:
Temporarily bypass our cache allowing you to see changes to your origin server in realtime.

**Note:** Enabling this feature can significantly increase origin server load. Development Mode does not purge the cache so files will need to be purged after development mode expires.
development_mode.help:
#### What does Development Mode do?
When Development Mode is on, all requests will be passed to the origin server. This allows requests for your website to temporarily bypass our cache so you can verify changes made to cached content.

This is useful if you need to see changes immediately. Once enabled, Development Mode lasts for three hours and then automatically turns off.

**Note:** Unless you are making major changes to your website, we recommend using the Purge Individual Files option instead of turning on Development Mode. This is because Development Mode will cause all requests to go to your origin server, and increased requests to your origin server will temporarily raise your bandwidth and CPU usage.
development_mode.title: Development Mode
edge_cache_ttl.description: Determine the length of time Cloudflare caches static files on our servers. Once this time expires, Cloudflare will request a live version of the resource from your origin server.
edge_cache_ttl.help:
#### What does Edge cache expiration do?
Edge cache expiration is a parameter that controls how long Cloudflareu2019s edge servers will cache a resource before returning to your origin server for a fresh copy.

Sometimes cache headers are set on the server-side or by a CMS solution like WordPress. If you choose to Cache Everything, Cloudflare respects existing headers, which tells our edge nodes to hold the item in the cache for the time specified by the origin. If no headers are specified at the origin for the resource, our edge nodes will still cache the resource.

The minimum Edge cache expiration varies by plan type:

- **Free:** 2 hours
- **Pro:** 1 hour
- **Business:** 30 minutes
- **Enterprise:** 30 seconds

**Note:** The Edge cache expiration time is not visible in response headers, it is an internal value respected by our edge nodes.
edge_cache_ttl.title: Edge cache expiration
purge_cache.modal.title: Purge Cache
purge_cache.description:
Instantly purge cached files to force Cloudflare to fetch a fresh version of those files from your web server. You can purge files selectively or all at once.

**Note:** Purging the cache may temporarily degrade performance for your website and increase load on your origin.
purge_cache.help:
#### What does Purge Individual Files do?
An individual purge removes a single file from Cloudflareu2019s cache, leaving the rest of your files in place. This option is recommended to prevent Cloudflare pulling all your content from your origin server every time you perform a purge.

[Learn more about Purge Cache](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache).

**Note:** Wildcards are not supported with single file purge at this time. You will need to specify the full path to the file.

#### What does Purge Everything do?
Purging the entire cache means requests will be sent to your origin web server(s) so they can be cached again. If you have many assets and lots of traffic, the increase in requests to your origin server will increase your bandwidth and CPU usage.

A full cache purge may sometimes be appropriate and will immediately purge all cached resources for your website. This will force Cloudflare to expire all static files cached prior your action and fetch a new version when requested by visitors.

**Note:** We recommend using the Purge Individual Files option instead of Purge Everything in most situations because purging everything will increase requests to your origin server temporarily raising your bandwidth and CPU usage.

#### What does Purge by Tag do?
Purge by Tag allows Cloudflare Enterprise customers to assign Cache-Tags to cached content and to later purge all content from cache with a specific Cache-Tag. Cache-Tags are added in a response header, formatted like this:

`Cache-Tag: tag1,tag2,tag3`
purge_cache.help.free:
#### What does Purge Individual Files do?
An individual purge removes a single file from Cloudflareu2019s cache, leaving the rest of your files in place. This option is recommended to prevent Cloudflare pulling all your content from your origin server every time you perform a purge.

[Learn more about Purge Cache](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/purge-cache).

**Note:** Wildcards are not supported with single file purge at this time. You will need to specify the full path to the file.

#### What does Purge Everything do?
Purging the entire cache means requests will be sent to your origin web server(s) so they can be cached again. If you have many assets and lots of traffic, the increase in requests to your origin server will increase your bandwidth and CPU usage.

A full cache purge may sometimes be appropriate and will immediately purge all cached resources for your website. This will force Cloudflare to expire all static files cached prior your action and fetch a new version when requested by visitors.

**Note:** We recommend using the Purge Individual Files option instead of Purge Everything in most situations because purging everything will increase requests to your origin server temporarily raising your bandwidth and CPU usage.

#### What does Purge by Tag do?
Purge by Tag allows to assign Cache-Tags to cached content and to later purge all content from cache with a specific Cache-Tag. Cache-Tags are added in a response header, formatted like this:

`Cache-Tag: tag1,tag2,tag3`

purge_cache.warning.purge_all: Purge all cached files. Purging your cache may slow your website temporarily.
crawler_hints.banner: **New!** We have just added Crawler Hints. [Try it now](#crawler-hints).
crawler_hints.card.title: Crawler Hints
crawler_hints.card.description:
Crawler Hints provide high quality data to search engines and other crawlers when sites using Cloudflare change their content. This allows crawlers to precisely time crawling, avoid wasteful crawls, and generally reduce resource consumption on origins and other Internet infrastructure.

By enabling this service, you agree to share website information required for feature functionality and agree to the [Supplemental Terms](https://www.cloudflare.com/supplemental-terms/#crawler-hints) for Crawler Hints.
crawler_hints.card.help:
#### How does Crawler Hints work?

When enabled, Cloudflare pushes signals to networks that operate large crawling operations, such as search engines, when we believe content on your website has changed and needs to be re-indexed.

Search engines crawl your website depending on algorithms that differ based on provider. Often, the cadence search engines crawl your site is based on either a regular interval or data about past website updates, and these factors may not be aligned with real world content changes. This crawling approach may not only harm customer page rank, but also works to the detriment of a search engine's operational costs and environmental impact. The goal of Crawler Hints is to help search indexers make a more informed decision on when content has changed to make the Internet greener and more energy efficient.

[Crawler Hints: How Cloudflare Is Reducing The Environmental Impact Of Web Searches](https://blog.cloudflare.com/crawler-hints-how-cloudflare-is-reducing-the-environmental-impact-of-web-searches/)
csam_scanner.card.title: CSAM Scanning Tool
csam_scanner.card.description:
The Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM) Scanning Tool allows website owners to proactively identify and take action on potential CSAM located on their website. 

With this service enabled, the tool will attempt to match hashes of your cached images against hashes of known CSAM. When a match is made, the tool will:
- Block the URL where the content has been found
- Email you with the file path to enable you to permanently remove the image
csam_scanner.card.control.unverified_ema:
Set and verify an email address
to start receiving alerts.
A verification email has been
sent to %{email}.
csam_scanner.card.drawers.help_content:
Once activated, this tool will automatically identify content on your website that appears to match known CSAM. If the tool results in a match, Cloudflare will the website owner at the email provided so that you can take prompt action to address this material.

You understand that  using this tool does not relieve you of any legal requirements that might arise from your use of the CSAM Scanning Tool, including, but not limited to, any obligation you have to file NCMEC reports or reports in other jurisdictions. You can file a report to NCMEC with additional information via [NCMECu2019s CyberTip reporting form](https://report.cybertip.org/) or find the preferred reporting portal for your jurisdiction via the [INHOPE website](https://www.inhope.org/EN).

For more information regarding the CSAM Scanning Tool, refer to our [documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/reference/csam-scanning/).

If you would like to request an exemption from the auto-blocking functionality please contact Cloudflareu2019s Trust & Safety team at csamblock@cloudflare.com.

sort_query_string_for_cache.description: Cloudflare will treat files with the same query strings as the same file in cache, regardless of the order of the query strings
sort_query_string_for_cache.help:
#### How does Query String Sort make my website faster?

When set to u201COnu201D, this feature enables query strings to be sorted before they hit Cloudflareu2019s cache for increased cache hit rates.

 Today, we treat URLs query strings that are in different orders as separate files in the cache. This mean that if one user requests:

```
/video/48088296?title=0&byline=0&portrait=0&color=51a516
```

And another user requests:

```
/video/48088296?byline=0&color=51a516&portrait=0&title=0
```

We will go back to the origin, even though we have the file in our cache. 

Query String Sort will sort the query strings before they hit our cache resulting in a higher cache hit rate.
sort_query_string_for_cache.title: Enable Query String Sort

When there's a cache miss Cloudflare will first check these storage buckets before going to your origin.

caching.cache_reserve.modals.pause.title: Pause Cache Reserve?
Cached assets will no longer be served from nor copied to storage buckets. This may result in decreased cache lifetimes.
Cached assets in the storage buckets will continue to incur data storage costs until they expire.
You can resume Cache Reserve at any time.
caching.cache_reserve.modals.enable.body: Cached assets will get copied to storage buckets when fetched from your origin, then served from these storage buckets for all subsequent requests. These storage buckets will begin incurring usage costs.
You can pause Cache Reserve at any time. Cached assets will continue to be charged for data storage until they expire.

caching.cache_reserve.promo.description: Cache Reserve is a large data store that acts as the ultimate top tier cache. Sitting between our edge data center and your origin server, it stores data with guaranteed SLAs for how long your content remains in cache.

Treat requests with the same query parameters the same, regardless of the order those query parameters are in.

Define which components of the request are included or excluded from the cache key Cloudflare uses to store the response in cache.
Changing the below settings will modify the cache key, effectively purging cache for matching URLs
Define which headers will go into the Cache Key. <0>Learn more.</0>
Match on all values in header, include only matched values in the cache key. For <0>restricted</0> headers you need to include from 1 to 10 values.

Deliver the same resource to everyone independent of the query string
Define if Cloudflare should use error pages issued by the origin server in case of HTTP error status codes.
When enabled, HTTP error pages will be issued from the origin server instead of Cloudflare.
Specify if and how long Cloudflare should cache the response, depending on if a cache-control header is present on the origin response.
Add the request's port to the <0>list of ports</0> that Cloudflare considers eligible for caching.
When off, Cloudflare converts strong ETag headers to weak ETag headers.
Specify whether or not Cloudflare should respect strong ETag (entity tag) headers.
Do not serve stale content while updating
If on, Cloudflare will not serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
Define if Cloudflare should serve stale content while getting the latest content from the origin.
Specify how long Cloudflare should cache the response based on the status code from the origin.
caching.cache_rules.rules.form.cache_sta: Mark whether the requestu2019s response from origin is eligible for caching. Caching itself will still depend on the cache-control header and your other caching configurations.
caching.cache_rules.rules.form.override_: Ignore cache-control header and use this TTL
caching.cache_rules.rules.form.respect_o: Use cache-control header if present, cache request with Cloudflare's default TTL for the response status if not
caching.cache_rules.rules.form.bypass_by: Use cache-control header if present, bypass cache if not
caching.cache_rules.rules.form.override_: Override origin and use this TTL
caching.cache_rules.rules.action_paramet: Define a timeout between two successive read operations.
Select or add a duration in seconds
The maximum timeout is %{max} and the minimum is %{min}.
Incorporate ports into the cache strategy.
Please enter a port number between %{min} and %{max}.
Mark whether the request's response from origin is eligible for Cache Reserve (requires a Cache Reserve <0> add-on plan </0> ).

When on, Cloudflare will manage the content directly from the origin.
Define cache-control headers to tell how Cloudflare handles content from the origin.
